meanings.definition: To be unwilling to give or spend; be stingy.
meanings.sent1: She always stinges on sharing her snacks with others.
meanings.sent2: He tends to stinge when it comes to buying gifts for his friends.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel seemed to stinge on sharing its nuts with the other animals.
meanings.sent4: Her heart stinges when it comes to donating to charity.
meanings.sent5: The old man's eyes stinge as he counts his coins, reluctant to part with any.

meanings.definition: A small amount of something, especially money.
meanings.sent1: He found a stinge of coins at the bottom of his pocket.
meanings.sent2: She only had a stinge of sugar left for her coffee.
meanings.sent3: The tiny stinge of paint left in the can was not enough to finish the job.
meanings.sent4: A stinge of hope flickered in her eyes as she searched for a solution.
meanings.sent5: The last stinge of sunlight disappeared behind the horizon, signaling the end of the day.
